intro: Peucedanum macrocoleum, commonly known as large-seeded angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodlands. The plant features tall, slender stems with finely divided, fern-like leaves that can reach several feet in height. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The roots of Peucedanum macrocoleum are used in traditional medicine and are known for their distinctive, spicy aroma.
